titlestmt.titleproper: A Finding Aid to the Moses Ros Papers, 1978-2012, in the Archives of American Art
titlestmt.author: Sarah Mundy
titlestmt.sponsor: The processing of this collection received Federal support from the Latino Initiatives Pool, administered by the Smithsonian Latino Center.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 15:13:15 -0400.

did.abstract: The papers of Dominican American installation artist Moses Ros measure 2.3 linear feet and date from 1978 to 2012. The collection is comprised of files for several New York City Housing Authority commissions, as well as architecture, sculpture, and mural projects; professional files for Dominican York Proyecto GRAFICA, MUD/BONE Print Studio, and a New York American Institute of Architects residency; printed materials; and artwork that includes doodles, sketches, mock ups, and a paper and feather mask.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The papers were donated in 2016 by Moses Ros.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was processed and a finding aid prepared by Sarah Mundy in 2018.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Moses Ros papers, 1978-2012. Archives of American Art, Smithsonian Institution.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Moses Ros (1958- ), also known as Moses Ros-Su√°rez, is a Dominican American installation artist in Bronx, New York. He was born in New York City to Dominican born parents. Ros received a bachelor's degree in architecture from Pratt Institute and is a licensed architect in the state of New York. He incorporates his knowledge of architecture into his numerous sculptural designs for community centers, daycare facilities, and other public spaces. He has completed sculpture, design, and mural commissions for the New York City Housing Authority, Bronx Council on the Arts, the Department of Cultural Affairs, and the Metropolitan Transit Authority. Ros has also been active with collaborative artist groups such as Dominican York Proyecto GRAFICA and MUD/Bone Print Studio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers of Dominican American installation artist Moses Ros measure 2.3 linear feet and date from 1978 to 2012. The collection is comprised of files for several New York City Housing Authority commissions, as well as architecture, sculpture, and mural projects; professional files for Dominican York Proyecto GRAFICA, MUD/BONE Print Studio, and a New York American Institute of Architects residency; printed materials; and artwork that includes doodles, sketches, mock ups, and a paper and feather mask.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged as four series.

list.item: Series 1: Commission and Project Files, circa 2000 (Boxes 1, 4, OV 5; 0.8 linear feet)
Series 3: Printed Materials, 1978-2012 (Boxes 1, 4, OV 6; 0.3 linear feet)
Series 4: Artwork, circa 2000 (Boxes 1-4, OV 6; 1.0 linear feet)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains correspondence, sketches, progress reports, photographs, agreements, invoices and receipts, and other documents relating to commissions for the New York City Housing Authority and Metropolitan Transit Authority. Also included are project files for paintings, sculptures, artist books, murals, and an exhibition for the Longwood Arts Project.

did.unittitle: Bubbles of Dreams, Washington Heights Daycare Center - Relief Sculptures

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Plans for the benches include a version incorporating Ros's Myles Davis sculpture.

did.unittitle: Fulton Street Transit Center Design, Application

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs of Freedom, Mi Casita, and unidentified projects.

did.unittitle: "Physical Place, Virtual Space," Exhibition for Longwood Arts Project

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes giant print, head, poet, and various other sculpture projects.

did.unittitle: St. Nicholas Houses Community Center, Mural
Ta√≠novivo, Hostos Center for the Arts and Culture - Mobile
Ta√≠novivo, Hostos Center for the Arts and Culture - Mobile
Throgg's Neck Houses Community Center, Process Photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professional files document Ros's activities outside of his commission and project work. Meeting notes and agendas, correspondence, contracts, guidelines, and printed materials are included in files for the artist groups Dominican York Proyecto GRAFICA and MUD/BONE Print Studio. Additionally, a notebook and other material for a business course, information regarding a residency with the New York American Institute of Architects, receipts, and research material are also in the series.

did.unittitle: "Make Your Art Your Business," Course Material
New York American Institute of Architects, Residency

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes an artist's services list, article on Alexander Calder, a paper on Leonardo Da Vinci, and information on mural and outdoor sculpture materials and techniques.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed materials consist of art reproductions, booklets, clippings, exhibition catalogs and announcements, newsletters, and posters regarding Ros and his artwork, public artwork in New York City, and arts organizations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a mock up of the Empowerment exhibition catalog.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Doodles interspersed with notes, sketches for various projects, a paper and feather mask, and mock ups that include panels covered with paint or colored paper are in artwork.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mask is constructed from colored paper and feathers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a wooden rod, paper circle, mosaic sample, and a small animal sculpture.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes rectangular panels covered with drawings and colored paper.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes painted gold rectangular panels and a "Trabajos Armados" banner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some sketches are photocopies from a sketchbook.
